Keep up the momentum to protect repro rights in the Commonwealth
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

We're fired up! Last Thursday, hundreds of you came to the Capitol to stand for reproductive rights.

It was an incredible day, and if we can keep up this momentum, we will be able to pass protections for pregnant workers and stop bills that threaten abortion access.

Here are some steps you can take to help us keep up the momentum:

  1. Email your legislators and ask them to support the Pregnant Workers' Rights Act and to oppose anti-abortion bills like House Bill 103, which attempt to further limit access to abortion in the Commonwealth.

  2. Amplify our reproductive rights work on social media. Follow ACLU of Kentucky on Twitter. Share and RT our content, and share your own rally pictures using #WeareKY #WeWillNotGoBack and #kyga18.

  3. Meet with your legislator to discuss reproductive rights, especially if you have a personal story to share. Email our Community Engagement Coordinator George Eklund, and he can provide you with talking points ahead of your meeting.

We can protect reproductive rights from additional rollbacks through your continued support. Thank you for raising your voice!

Sincerely,

Michael Aldridge
Executive Director
ACLU of Kentucky
